metadata.titel_preek: Truth-Filled Futures Trinity Sunday, Year C

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Spirit of God (Subject) guides the Church (Receiver) into the truth of Jesus' way of justice and mercy (Object) to overcome the despair of a violent world (Opponent).

subject.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / The Spirit of Truth
tekstueel_bewijs: The Spirit... does is to guide us in all truth.
The Spirit not only indwells the world, but is actively and acutely present to the church.
The Spirit does not quit. It comes upon us.

object.identificatie: Gospel Truth / The Future / Alternative Way of Justice
tekstueel_bewijs: The truth of giving ourselves away for the sake of the neighbor.
Jesus makes provision for his companions.
God’s love has been poured into our hearts through the Holy Spirit.
Jesus comforts and assures the church.
The Holy Spirit that has been given to us.
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver of the Spirit's guidance.

tekstueel_bewijs: The same drama is performed in the great creeds of the church.
So Paul can write of such obedient suffering.
helper.rol_van_god: God (Spirit) is the Subject, not merely a Helper.

tegenstander.identificatie: The World / Spirit of Lies / Money, Power, and Violence
tekstueel_bewijs: The world of money, power, and violence does not want itself exposed as hopeless fraud.
The spirit of lies who has led us to believe...
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is described as a 'spirit of lies' and a systemic global order that hates the church.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Church (Subject) engages in neighborly service and suffering (Object) to produce hope.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church / The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The primary program (Spirit's arrival) enables the secondary program (Church's engagement).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: The Father → Gospel Truth → The Church
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Gospel Logic → The Spirit ← Spirit of Lies

voorbeelden_god_subject: The Spirit... guides us in all truth.
God’s love has been poured into our hearts.
Jesus makes provision for his companions.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We focus for half the year on the life of Jesus.
If we want to break out of despair, get engaged.

voorbeelden: called his disciples... to follow him in the way of justice.
The Spirit knows and teaches us.
He will take what is mine and declare it to you.
The Spirit that permits the church to be bold.
We are able to see that the world’s way... is a dead end.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the Spirit granting the 'power to see' and 'power to act' (Pouvoir) rather than mere obligation (Devoir).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Worldly violence) to ~S1 (Despair), then through the Spirit to S1 (Truth) and ~S2 (Hope).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The Spirit 'comes upon us' to break the cycle of worldly lies, moving the hearer from despair to hope.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; the sermon names poverty and incarceration as concrete manifestations of S2.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While there is a strong call to action, the 'engine' is the Holy Spirit who provides the competence that humans lack. The Subject of the primary transformation is God.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Conditional logic in the Paul section
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: If we want to break out of despair, get engaged.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the provider of resources
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: They will not be left alone to their own resources.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: Spirit as the active agent of awareness
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The Spirit does not quit. It comes upon us.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Jesus is not presented as a mere example to mimic, but as the one whose Spirit indwells the church to continue his work.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: The Spirit continues the work of Jesus through the church.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Empowerment and reassurance against a hostile environment.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology is participatory; we are caught up in the Spirit's work.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the life of Jesus to the life of the Spirit is structurally mirrored in the sermon's progression.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'getting engaged' (Human Subject) and 'the Spirit comes upon us' (Divine Subject).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Our reading today invites us to participate in that great drama.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit grants the 'Pouvoir-faire' (capacity) to look beyond self-interest.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as a 'spirit of lies' and systemic exploitation, not just personal mistakes.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God/Spirit as the Subject of the primary narrative, positioning the church as the Receiver of a new reality.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: None major, though the 'If we want... get engaged' line briefly shifts to a human subject.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Ensure the 'engagement' is framed as a fruit of the Spirit's power.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Because the Spirit has broken our despair, we find ourselves engaged in the neighborhood.

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Maintain the focus on the Spirit's arrival.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Slightly more emphasis on the 'Vouloir' (how the Spirit changes our desires).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Expand on how the Spirit makes the 'odd mission' of Jesus attractive to us.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Strongly identified as systemic and spiritual lies.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The sermon already avoids 'cheap grace' by taking the world's hatred seriously.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A structurally sound, grace-oriented sermon that avoids moralism by making the Holy Spirit the primary actor who enables human response.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'town of Cincinnati' imagery, Greimas reveals that the Spirit is the functional 'engine' driving the transition from despair to hope.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Johannine 'Paraclete'; Greimas shows how the Paraclete functions as the Subject who grants competence to an incompetent Church.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the sermon's power comes from the 'Subject-switch'—moving from the disciples' 'own resources' to the Spirit's 'Pouvoir'.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the Creeds as a 'Helper' actant to validate the narrative movement.
